docs.title: ADR 001 — Adopt polyrepo
docs.text:
Status: Proposed

Decision: Use polyrepo layout for service separation and independent lifecycle.

Rationale: Improves autonomy and CI/CD isolation.

docs.title: ADR 002 — Use circuit breaker (fail-open)
docs.text:
Status: Accepted

Decision: Circuit breakers are used but configured to fail-open on timeout to prioritize availability.

Consequences: Faster fallback, but may allow degraded requests through.

docs.title: ADR 003 — Sync vs Async Paths
docs.text:
Status: Proposed

Decision: Use sync paths for payment authorization, async for non-blocking analytics.

docs.title: ADR 004 — Redis for velocity checks
docs.text:
Status: Accepted

Decision: Use Redis for short-lived counters and rate-limiting across instances.

docs.title: Post-mortem: 2024-12-20 Latency Spike
docs.text:
Summary: Simulated incident where increased external dependency latency caused higher request times.

Root cause: Downstream payment gateway slowed during peak traffic.

Actions: Add circuit-breaker tuning and more aggressive retries.

docs.title: Runbook: Alert — High Latency
docs.text:
When latency-alert fires for the payment router (PRM):

  1. Check Prometheus graphs for request latency.
  2. Verify PRM pods are healthy.
  3. If CPU high, scale up replicas.
